newsitem.title: UK: Telewest says it will match BT cuts.
newsitem.headline: Telewest says it will match BT cuts.

text.p: Telewest Communications said it would make "minor adjustments" to its tariffs to respond to price cuts effective October announced by rival British Telecommunications (BT) earlier this week.

In a statement, Telewest said "minor adjustments to our tariffs will be required to maintain our existing commitments...that all calls made by one of our customers will be less than BT's standard rates...(and) that every cable telephone bill will be less than the comparable BT bill."
It took a swipe at BT's proposed package of cuts, saying it was "simply a war of words," and merely complied with price caps set by the industry regulator Oftel.
BT said the reductions, on national weekday calls and selected international calls, would total 214 million stg.
